questions.question: Which option best captures what a protocol specifies to ensure consistent interpretation?
options: Message format, timing, and transmission rate
Source IP, destination IP, and MAC address
HTTP methods, DNS records, and frames
File chunk sizes, swarm size, and tracker URL
questions.answer: Message format, timing, and transmission rate

questions.question: Which set lists reliability controls provided by protocols?
options: DNS queries, port numbers, MAC addresses
HTTP requests, FTP uploads, DNS responses

questions.question: Flow control is used to:
options: Prevent receiver overload by limiting sent data before confirmation
Split files into chunks for parallel transfer
Add source and destination IP addresses
questions.answer: Prevent receiver overload by limiting sent data before confirmation

questions.question: A parity ______ is one extra 0 or 1 added so the total count of 1s matches an agreed rule.
Under even parity, the total number of 1s in each transmitted data unit is:
In a layered stack, each layer:
options: Replaces the layer above and ignores the layer below
Offers services to the layer above and uses services of the layer below through interfaces
Works only when all layers share the same port number
questions.answer: Offers services to the layer above and uses services of the layer below through interfaces

questions.question: When a computer is receiving data, processing moves from the ______ layer to the ______ layer of the protocol stack.
When sending data, processing through the protocol stack moves:
Adding a layer-specific header to the data received from above is called ______.
At the Internet layer the unit is an IP packet, also called a ______.
Match layer to its data unit.
Which lists the TCP/IP layers in order from top on the sender to bottom?
Match layer to its core purpose.

pairs.Application: End-user services and application protocols such as HTTP, SMTP, DNS, FTP, POP3, IMAP
pairs.Transport: End-to-end delivery, sequencing, and error recovery
pairs.Internet: Source and destination IP addressing and routing between networks with connectionless forwarding
pairs.Link: Local delivery on the physical medium with frames and a frame check

questions.question: Which statement distinguishes TCP from UDP as given?
options: TCP is connectionless with lower overhead; UDP is connection-oriented with ACKs
TCP is connection-oriented with acknowledgements and retransmission; UDP is connectionless with lower overhead
Both are connection-oriented with port numbers only in UDP
Both are connectionless and never use ports
questions.answer: TCP is connection-oriented with acknowledgements and retransmission; UDP is connectionless with lower overhead

questions.question: The Link layer uses ______ addresses to forward frames within a LAN.
Which device operates at the Internet layer and forwards using a routing table?
TCP uses destination ______ to direct data to the correct application.
In a web page fetch, which layer adds source and destination IP addresses?
Ethernet frames include a ______ for integrity checking.
In the example, the destination port commonly used for HTTP is:
A network device that operates at the Link layer and forwards frames based on MAC addresses is a:
Match each protocol to its purpose.

pairs.HTTP: Client-server request-response used by browsers to fetch web resources
pairs.FTP: Application-layer transfer of files between systems
pairs.SMTP: Sending email from client to server and between mail servers
pairs.POP3: Downloading email to the client, typically removing it from the server
pairs.IMAP: Accessing email while keeping messages on the server for multi-device access

questions.question: Match each BitTorrent term with its definition.

pairs.Tracker: A server that lists peers and the pieces they hold
pairs.Swarm: The group of all peers currently sharing the same torrent
pairs.Seeder: A peer that has the complete file and uploads pieces to others
pairs.Leecher: A peer that is still downloading pieces and has not yet completed the file

questions.question: In the example, a 20 MiB file split into 1 MiB pieces results in how many chunks?
BitTorrent enables:
options: Sequential download from a single server
Simultaneous download and upload among peers
Web page requests to remote servers
questions.answer: Simultaneous download and upload among peers
